result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah A Luedtke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay costs w/DNA surcharge $250.    If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment /Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription  and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. 
Disclose any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.   
Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.   
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge $250.   
No contact with co-defendants Chad Wampole,  Jahn Tinglum, and Shawyna  Goetz. 
Complete a Cognative Thinking Course/treatment.  
Participate and complete a parenting class.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.

Ct 2: 1 yr concurrent jail 
w/365 days credit - time served both counts.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on July 28, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Leah A Luedtke in court with attorney Karen Lueschow. Defendant Leah A Luedtke in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Ct 1 & 2: 4 yrs Probation: Conditions: 9 mo Jail, 100 hrs Community Service,  Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and sign releases so agent can monitor.   Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.   Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment/Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.   Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.   Engage and comply in any other counseling reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent. Contact with co-defendant at the Agent's approval.  Counts 3, 4, & 5 to be DRI.  Request for PSI report.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant enters a plea of: No contest to Count 1 & 2
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim notification is complied with by the State.
BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Cts. 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. Counts 3, 4, & 5 are Dismissed Read In.

Court orders PSI, due to parties by 07-24-14.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 9, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial on September 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leah A Luedtke in court with Attorney Karen Lueschow.  Defendant Leah A Luedtke in CUSTODY.  Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

No Plea Hearing to be held today as will be going to a Jury Trial.

BY THE COURT:
Set for Jury Trial on September 24, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. for 2 days starting at 8:30 a.m. and will be in #3 position.
Bond conditions of bond continued
Plea hearing on May 27, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Leah A Luedtke in court with attorney Karen Lueschow. Defendant Leah A Luedtke in custody. Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:01 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

This is a motion for a bond modification.

Atty Lueschow addresses the Court, her client is requesting a modification, has been incarcerated since 2/11/14. Defendant has children who live with her parents right now. She would be residing with her parents if released and looking for a job and caring for her children. Defendant requests a signature bond. Defendant is requesting that this case be held in a timely fashion.

Atty Isherwood addresses the Court, there has not been any new information provided to the Court. These are serious allegations. Defendant did have possession of meth. Two of the co-defendants were stealing from Walmart. Atty Isherwood states biggest concern regarding Defendant.  Defendant does not have a history of appearing in Court.  Defendant was not honest in front of the Judge at the bond hearing.  Atty Isherwood states bond should remain as is.   All the co-defendant also have had bond motions as well.

Atty Lueschow addresses the Court, replies to the issue regarding appearing in Court. 

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Court agrees the original bond in the case was appropriately set.
Court denies request at this time.

Atty Isherwood requests a plea hearing to be set. State will be requesting a PSI.

Notice will be sent by the clerk.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 11:30 am.

Court calls cases at  1:35 PM .
ADA  Isherwood appears in Court.  
Defendants appear from jail by video.
Cases heard are 14GF-38 (14PT274) and 14GF-39 (14PT-273), co-defendants.

ADA  Isherwood states facts for anticipated charges of Retail Theft and Possession of Methamphetamine and Obstructing for Ms. Luedtke and Retail Theft and Obstructing for Mr. Wampole.

Court informs Defendant of right to remain silent.
Ms. Luedtke wishes to plead not guilty and wants a public defender.

Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendants.

State addresses bond, some cash bond, no contact with the three co-defendants, no contact with Walmart Stores in WI, drugs, day report on court dates.
Ms. Luedtke addresses the bond, requests signature bond.
Ms. Luedtke states that Mr. Wampole is her husband and wishes contact, they are still married and live together.
